content.description:
***Beware, there is poison ivy near this boulder problem.***

Sit start with a left hand on the arete and a high right hand crimp. From there, bump the left up to an edge on the arete's elbow, then traverse right though a polished sloper, eventually gain a good right hand sidepull, and mantle on top for the send.
content.protection: The immediate landing is flat and clear, but there is a boulder that sits behind where the problem climbs. It wasn't an issue for me, but a spotter wouldn't hurt along with a pair of pads.
content.location: It climbs the east face of Chamber.

content.description:
Unthinking climbs an overhanging lowball on great rock over a very good landing.

Sit start with left hand sidepull on the mini-arete and a right hand sidepull on the waving hueco feature. From there, stick left hand on the diagonal shelf, walk the feet over to the left, fall into an intermediate right hand sidepull, then match the right hand next to the left on the diagonal shelf, dyno to the shelf's apex, match, crank the jugs, and mantle on top.
content.protection: A pair of pads will work well. The landing is flat and clear, but there is a boulder behind the problem. A spotter wouldn't hurt.
content.location:
It climbs the east of Chamber, just right of where

Urushiol

.

climbs.name: Leaves of Three, Let It Be

content.description:
***Beware, there is poison ivy in and around this landing.***

Sit start with hands matched in the hueco and a right heel hook in the hueco next to it. From there, crank up to a sloping right hand (if you can reach the edge, good for you, it is probably going to be easier for you), move out to a left hand sidepull, then move up to a left hand sidepull/undercling and a right hand hueco, ball up, make a big static reach to the lip, and mantle on top.
content.protection: A pad will work fine. The landing is flat and clear, but, and it's a big but, there is poison ivy smattered throughout the landing. It is probably better left for the winter months, but be cautious, because even the stems during winter can be poisonous.
content.location: It climbs the south face of Chamber.
